# removeArrangedSubview(_:)

**Instance Method**

Removes a view as an arranged split pane.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func removeArrangedSubview(_ view: NSView)
```

## Discussion

If the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/arrangesAllSubviews] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], calling this method doesn’t remove the view as a subview; it remains in the split view’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/subviews] array.

If you remove a view as a subview (either by calling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/removeFromSuperview()] or removing it from the split view’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/subviews] array), the system automatically removes the view as an arranged subview.

## Arranging Subviews

- **arrangesAllSubviews**: A Boolean value that determines whether the split view arranges all of its subviews as split panes.
- **arrangedSubviews**: The array of views that the split view arranges as its split panes.
- **addArrangedSubview(_:)**: Adds a view as an arranged split pane.
- **insertArrangedSubview(_:at:)**: Adds a view as an arranged split pane at the specified index.
